column22: I felt better but it was still confusing to me as I struggle with Math in general
column23: I think the quickness was the real problem and also being in a real classroom would’ve been better for asking questions

column22: I did not pass statistics during the spring quarter and did not understand anything. Taking this course was much more organized and I understood all concepts so much faster.
column23: I think telling me what I did wrong for all assignments would have been helpful.

column22: I've always had the same perspective when it comes to math. It's hard but it takes time.
column23: commit days to just lectures and commit days for just assignments

column22: I think because I came into this class with previous experience with the coding aspect of statistics, I learned more about the interpretation of graphical summaries and using formulas and equations to compute manually what code can do automatically. This course also helped me become a better writer when explaining concepts. Although lengthy, I found the questions that were "explain to someone who isn't in statistics" structured really helpful to clarify my own understanding. I chose no change because this course evened out my statistics knowledge that I had before.
column23: As a deadline driven student, I understood that the assignments such as labs and investigations were due by the end of the day and not the class, but sometimes on longer labs and investigations, having only one hour (sometimes less) to complete the assignment did make me panic a little as I felt rushed to complete this by the end of class, so sometimes I felt like the goal of class was to complete the assignment, because there wasn't much time to settle with the new information being learned every day. However, I feel like this is more a personal flaw that I can definitely work on. I know the duration of the class is out of the instructor's hands, but maybe allocating a little more time for the group work would have made me a better learner and increase my confidence in my abilities.

column22: I took AP stats in highschool, it felt the same.
column23: Practice quizzes to test yourself rather than it being behind a paywall with the textbook.

column22: I am currently a statistics major switching to another major but taking this class made me appreciate statistics more than I thought I did.
column23: I could have gone to office hours more.

column22: I previously took a different stats but I had to drop the class due to a loss of love one and bad mental health and not doing well. But in this class I felt like I learned more and understand, it was a bit confusing but easier to grasp and more interesting. I'm very grateful for this class. And I hope for the best for my grade :)
column23: more learn with the teacher and a different time for the class.

column22: I feel as though I learned a lot more to where if there was a second part to this class, I would feel ready!
column23: Maybe a little bit of independent work just to see as a test if I could really do it on my own.

column22: Before going into statistics, I was nervous. I took AP statistics in highschool and didn’t have the best teacher so it kind of ruined my confidence in statistics. The way it was taught to me in this course provided enough practice and guidance that my confidence went up.
column23: Possible work through labs as a full class instead of a group

column22: I was previously a biological science major with a concentration in molecular and cellular biology. My first year of college was all stem courses. Through a lot of my classes I lost my confidence in s.t.e.m classes including stats. Although I loved biology the other courses made me rethink my major and I took a GE in the field that I am in now. I switched and I couldn't be happier. With that being said this is the first stem related class I've taken in over a year. I was nervous about taking this class but its needed for my major. I had locked up the s.t.e.m. side of my brain for over a year, however this class made me feel capable of learning, understanding and using statistics again.
column23: For a five week class over zoom I think there really isn't anything that could of been done differently. Maybe some kind of way to make the lecture more interactive since it is on zoom.

column22: Before I took this course I had no appreciation for statistic but after taking it I now value its importance
column23: the course was good

column22: This is my second time taking STATS and I definelty feel more confident and like I learned something.
column23: Gone to office hours.

column22: I found there to be times when there was no change I felt like okay maybe I will understand later on. But as the course progressed I was not understanding and I was seeming to fall even further behind than my peers because I was still struggling to grasp or even remember the concepts we learnt about in week one which arguably are the entire base of the class.
column23: The course did was it was supposed to and I don’t think it should have turned out this way for me but it is a personal thing that I need to overcome and actually begin asking for help when I don't understand.

column22: I found this class pretty useful because now I can understand the statistical portions of research papers, which gives me a lot more context as to how researchers drew their conclusions
I have always strugglged with stats and any math class in general. I dont think there was any change in my confidence, if anything I just felt super nervous during the presentation.
column23: I dont think anything, I just have bad anxiety and anything math related makes me nervous.

column22: i failed another statistics class so i was anxious to take this class again but i feel a little better after completing the class the second time with this professor
I've never taken statistics before and knew it would be a little difficult for me especially within a 5 week course period so I came in with neutral confidence.
column23: Perhaps give midterm/ final study guides.

column22: Honestly after taking STATS in highschool (a year ago) this class genuinely teach me way more therefore, I know i understood it way better.
column23: Definitely gone to office hours more. The reason I couldn’t go was because of work however, I should have emailed my professor instead of just always asking peers - most of the time professors are willing to help with anything!

column22: I had a lot going on this summer and it was really hard for me to keep up with this class.
column23: I would've taken this class maybe during the year or I would've not taken an internship during the summer.

column22: I'd say there was no change in my confidence because I went in with pretty low confidence and expectations and I pretty much did as well as I thought I would.

When I took statistics in high school I was always and consistently studying and struggling to keep up, but taking this class and watching lectures, reading the textbook as well as previous knowledge it helped me and my understanding for this course.
column23: Something to help increase my confidence in my abilities was give more practice problems before the exams and quizzes as extra help in preparation for the exam.

column22: I had a hard time initially with the course, especially with the midterm, but I took that as a wake up call to really try get the most out of lecture and the textbook which allowed me to really feel confident in my statistic skills by the end of this course.
column23: I really liked how the equation sheets were formatted, as they helped me realize the difference between each type of data structure we learned. I think seeing the equation sheets for the final and midterm earlier in the course could help me better understand topics.

column22: I based my answer off of high school statistics that was taken by me in the past. That was neither hard or easy.
column23: I could have studied harder.

column22: I feel that my confidence went up because I put in lots of work. I was able to fully understand a lot of concepts that I had no idea before. I felt that my confidence also increased becuase I found myself being the one that people asked help for when doing the labs and worksheets. Typically I always thought I was bad and "dumb" when it came to math and statistics.
column23: I think Dr. Demirci was one of the nices and most willing to help professors I have had. Although this was a summer sesssion and a very fast one I felt that I learned a lot and made connectons that I am beyong thanful for. I do not think that there was anything that she could have done as she was always willing to help and provide extra support if you needed and seeked it. Like I did.

column22: I've taken statistics as a course in the past, I feel more confident in my abilities to answer some questions that relate to this course's material after having taken the course.
column23: I believe the course did what it was supposed to, and the Professor was efficient in her use of time during lectures, in her answering of students' questions, and in the kind of classwork she assigned.
